holidays.name: If Pets Had Thumbs Day
holidays.description: A whimsical day to imagine what our pets would do if they had opposable thumbs.
holidays.origin: Started by pet enthusiasts and social media users as a fun way to celebrate the cleverness of animals, this unofficial holiday inspires hilarious memes and creative photos.
holidays.funFact: Though cats and dogs can’t hold thumbs, many use their paws in impressively dexterous ways—like opening doors or keyboards!

holidays.name: World Wildlife Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to celebrating and raising awareness of the world's wild animals and plants.
holidays.origin: Declared by the United Nations to be observed every March 3rd, honoring the date of the adoption of the CITES treaty in 1973.
holidays.funFact: The day helps highlight endangered species and encourages global efforts to protect biodiversity.

holidays.name: National Mulled Wine Day (UK)
holidays.description: A cozy celebration of warm, spiced mulled wine, perfect for chilly March evenings.
holidays.origin: Emerging from British food culture, this day celebrates the traditional winter beverage that lingers into early spring.
holidays.funFact: Mulled wine recipes often date back to medieval times, combining wine with spices like cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg for a taste of history.

holidays.name: National Anthem Day (USA)
holidays.description: Commemorates the adoption of the US national anthem, 'The Star-Spangled Banner' in 1931 on March 3rd.
holidays.origin: Officially recognized in 1931 by the US Congress to honor the patriotic song written during the War of 1812.
holidays.funFact: The anthem was originally a poem titled 'Defence of Fort M'Henry' written by Francis Scott Key in 1814.
